name: convert-warpfield
author: Washington University School of Medicin
description:
Convert a warpfield between conventions.

NIFTI world warpfields can be used directly on mm coordinates via sampling the three subvolumes at the coordinate and adding the sampled values to the coordinate vector.  They use the NIFTI coordinate system, that is, X is left to right, Y is posterior to anterior, and Z is inferior to superior.

NOTE: this command does not invert the warpfield, and to warp a surface, you must use the inverse of the warpfield that warps the corresponding volume.

The ITK format is used by ANTS.

You must specify exactly one -from option, but you may specify multiple -to options, and -to-fnirt may be specified more than once.

inputs.name: opt_absolute
inputs.description: warpfield was written in absolute convention, rather than relative

inputs.name: opt_from_itk_input
inputs.description: input is an ITK warpfield: the input warpfield

inputs.name: source_volume
inputs.description: the source volume used when generating the input warpfield

inputs.name: opt_absolute
inputs.description: warpfield was written in absolute convention, rather than relative

inputs.name: opt_to_world_output
inputs.description: write output as a NIFTI 'world' warpfield: output - the output warpfield

inputs.name: opt_to_itk_output
inputs.description: write output as an ITK warpfield: output - the output warpfield

inputs.name: to_fnirt
inputs.description: write output as a fnirt warpfield

type.name: to_fnirt
type.description: write output as a fnirt warpfield

inputs.name: source_volume
inputs.description: the volume you want to apply the warpfield to
